intro: Hieracium rohacsense subsp. rohacsense, commonly known as the Rohács hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its subspecies status reflects its distinct morphological and genetic traits compared to other Hieracium species.
